channel.title: NH Marijuana Bill 1623
channel.description:
Today was a great day for New Hampshire! A marijuana decriminalization bill (HB 1623) was passed in the house. Before it becomes a law, it needs to be passed by the senate and finally signed in by the governor. If this passes all the stages, it should be issued by January 1, 2009.
Decriminalization is not legalization, it just makes marijuana possession up to 1 and a quarter ounce (35 grams) will just be a violation and not a misdemeanor. New Hampshire has always had a huge amount of pot smokers and since I live in southern New Hampshire where weed is affluent, I also unfortunately know a lot of people who have gone to jail for possession/trafficking/selling. And it really sucks!
A few people may criticize me for saying weed should be decriminalized. But hey, people who abuse themselves should not go to jail. If someone smokes pot, that's their problem/concern/prerogative. Live and let live, and pass the blunt. :)
So I was just curious what other people think about bills like this. Please vote and please post your reasoning.
Website for more info: http://www.nhcommonsense.org The bill: http://www.gencourt.state.nh.us/legislation/2008/hb1623.html
~Ron

item.title: NH Marijuana Bill 1623
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:37, topic:190676”][quote author=step one link=topic=254200.msg2141516#msg2141516 date=1206740216]
Ron, I have such a strong urge to make a website with loads of facts and a poll to show people that weed isnt bad. I wish I had the balls to call someone important, but I guess I dont, and drinking is so much worst, who would you rather be on the road with, someone who has been drinking or someone high, Id take the high driver ANY day. :rolleyes:
[/quote]

I’d take neither, anyone who drives on any psychedelic deserves to have their testicles removed with a rusty spoon.[/quote]
What a coincidence, I threatened my friend with that same threat today. Are you a mind reader?

Read full topic

item.title: NH Marijuana Bill 1623
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I think Marijuana should be decriminalized, because it is such a trivial psychoactive which is essentially impossible to overdose on. If used in moderation, it benefits your health, and does little if no permanent damage to your body. If used responsibly, like alcohol, it can be quite enjoyable and socially acceptable.

Read full topic

item.title: NH Marijuana Bill 1623
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I called up the governor of my state today and told his secretary what I thought about it. She agreed with me and promised to tell the governor what I said. I’m hoping I can get more of my friends to help.

Read full topic

item.title: NH Marijuana Bill 1623
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

drug smugglers or pharmacologists?

pharmacologist: the science dealing with the preparation, uses, and esp. the effects of drugs.

I still consider it medicine. And people use pharmaceutical legal drugs right now to get high. Such as prozak, marinol, legal forms of speed (amphetamines), bzp, etc. Sooo all those people working at your local pharmacy must be drug dealers too.

But yea if it became ‘decriminalized’ (not legal), it would most likely increase the number of merchants in my state too.

Read full topic

item.title: NH Marijuana Bill 1623
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

mmm all I know is that the founding fathers smoked pot such as our first president. Even though this is a thomas jefferson link, it talks about Washington.
http://www.christers.net/veeps/thomas-jefferson.html

Thomas Jefferson smuggled in rare marijuana seeds from China lol. But you don’t see that plastered everywhere.
http://www.marijuanalibrary.org/7_presidents.html

[quote=“jme, post:14, topic:190676”]Yeah I’m really not an expert on law, especially American law.

But that was just what I read on wikipedia a while ago when they were decriminalizing it in Colorado.[/quote]
well they were able to successfully decriminalize it in 12 states. Lucky #13 if NH gets this bill passed. It passed the house, so just the senate and governor to go!

Read full topic
